page.title: 09The National Trust, Wetton
page.content: The National Trust is an independent charity which looks after places of historic interest, and places of outstanding beauty. The job involves general estate work etc., fencing and stone walling, improving the habitat for wildlife - birds, butterflies, etc., helping visitors by giving them information and directions, protecting the countryside owned by the National Trust against vandals etc. The N.T.'s property gets quite busy with visitors during the summer months, especially at weekends. In the winter there are not so many visitors. The N.T.'s land extends along the Manifold Valley and includes such properties as Ossom's Hill Farm, Ladyside Farm and Wetton Mill.
